title: STEM Integrated Comparative Problem-Solving Learning Design: Application of Hypothetical Learning Trajectories (HLT) and Design-Based Research (DBR)

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of basic STEM concepts, proficiency in comparative analysis methods, and language analysis skills
context.additional_context: Blended learning combining digital/analog activities in a BYOD environment, focusing on problem-solving through group collaboration

learning_goals: Learners can design hypothetical learning trajectories (HLT) for comparative problem-solving in an integrated STEM environment.
Learners iteratively improve learning activities using the Design-Based Research (DBR) methodology.
Learners cultivate the ability to systematically solve real-life problems through quantitative and qualitative comparative analysis.

resources: Online Collaboration Tools (Padlet, Google Workspace, etc.)
Digital Assessment Platforms (Quizlet, Google Forms, etc.)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
